pages.text: $(item)Symbols$(1) are a method of communicating one's intention to a higher power. By forming the metals into distinctive shapes, one can invoke the gods and have them do your bidding. $(0)$(br2)$(o)You can see what I'm working with here... Let me summarize.
$(o)A $(item)Copper Symbol$(0) brings out the changing nature of Copper to promote the movement of Power into a Crucible.
$(o)An $(item)Iron Symbol$(0) brings out the protective nature of Iron to prevent movement of Power. $(p)Its area of effect is far lesser than that of the Copper Symbol.
$(o)A $(item)Gold Symbol$(0) brings out Gold's radiance to make certain Reactions possible that otherwise would not occur.

$(o)The mechanics that cause these symbols to behave in these manners is unknown, but seems related to metallurgy. Copper promotes change, Iron promotes stability, Gold promotes radiance. Claiming a spiritual influence is at work seems reckless at best.
